turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Think she really killed those agents?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: She may not know. Theory goes she may be very ill.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Amnesia?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Possibly. Split personality ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Insane ... ?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Who knows? If Dr. Darling is right, you should watch out.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: She may try to kill you.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Something went wrong. System malfunction. Explosion. Mrs. Peel had a narrow escape. Suspected sabotage. Nothing proven. File still open.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: How come you took so much interest in her, Dr. Darling?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Still doesn't. Better safe than sorry.  She was in a dangerous game, Steed. High stakes. She may prove to be a risk.  If she is, there's only one solution.  Termination.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Anyone particular in mind?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: We had a lead to Wonderland Weather but we got there too late. Someone tipped them off ...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Too late anyway. Today's escapade was only for starters. This is no ordinary weather. It's manmade. A kind of weather bomb.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Impossible.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: This man -- did you see him?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: No. Her husband, she says. Alice tried to warn us. A trap. Tell Mother beware. Tell Father That's all.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You're accusing Mrs. Peel of killing her own husband?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Her husband suspected someone very close to the operation. On the day he died, he was setting a test. To prove to himself -- to us that his wife was beyond suspicion. He had to be certain. He said he was going to give Mrs. Peel something ...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Pity. I was growing fond of Mrs. Peel. Unfortunately --

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Guilty until proven innocent?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Mother and Father know best.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I was hoping you could tell me.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You're getting yourself into terrible trouble, my son. Weather's turning very nasty -- and so am I.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I'm going to follow up on a hunch of my own. If I'm right, Mrs. Peel is innocent and you have a mole.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: In your operation.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I'm warning you for the last time, Steed: whoever's behind all this, looks like Mrs. Peel, walks like Mrs. Peel and kills like Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: OLD LADY
turns.text: Are you alright, young man?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I think so, thank you so much ...

turns.speaker: OLD LADY
turns.text: Cocky little bastard. I hope he was a baddy.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I feel sure of it.

turns.speaker: OLD LADY
turns.text: I'm Alice. Mother said you'd be on your way. Mrs. Peel with you?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: She was ...

turns.speaker: OLD LADY
turns.text: You with Mother or Father?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Both, actually.

turns.speaker: OLD LADY
turns.text: Good. Glad to see they're together at last. They don't get along. Promotion. Top job. Most unfair. Quite a fuss at the Ministry.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You don't say.  Like looking for a needle in a ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Wonderland Weather Ltd.

turns.speaker: OLD LADY
turns.text: This way ...

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: Mrs. Peel -- ?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Ask not for whom the telephone rings ...

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: No, please! I beg you ...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Walk over to the window ...

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: Let it be rain, please let it be --

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Stay by the window. By the window.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: John Steed.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Valentine Peel. I see you've gone back to using your original face.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: The last one you'll ever see.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Perish the thought.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: You're better than I expected.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I was at Harrow ...

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: But did they teach you this?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Bang-bang ... you're dead.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: You wish.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: One shot -- for emergencies.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: That's not playing by the rules.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Rules are made to be broken.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: You said ... one shot.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Did I? My mistake.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Aren't you forgetting about something?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You are, and it's behind you.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Come, come. You don't really expect me to fall for --

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I think she really likes you ... Where's Mrs. Peel?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Ugh ...

turns.speaker: PHOEBE
turns.text: What's happening?

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: Debbie's marrying Rick.

turns.speaker: PHOEBE
turns.text: ...Really?

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: Does Cole know about this?

turns.speaker: PHOEBE
turns.text: Really -- you went with him for two years.

turns.speaker: PHOEBE
turns.text: I'm totally blown away. You're getting married. It seems like only yesterday I showed you how to have oral sex.

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: Deb, I want to throw you a shower.

turns.speaker: PHOEBE
turns.text: Look at that guy. What a hunk.

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: Check out the other guy's buns.

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: Debbie... I don't believe it. I'm so excited.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Bobbie, what are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: O'Neill just tole me. It's sooo great... I don't believe it.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: He still thinks I'm going with him. I'm going to break the news to him tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: He's not gonna be happy. And your parents can't be too thrilled either.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: No. As far as they're concerned the only good Rick is a dead Rick. But I don't care... it's my decision.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: What do you think's gonna go on at the guys' party?

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: They'll probably get drunk, and watch dirty movies. But don't worry about the dirty movies.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: I forgot to tell you. Yesterday I found a bunch of pornos in the back seat of O'Neill's car.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: Nah. Everything's cool... I took care of 'em.

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: That's what we're going to find out...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I feel like I'm spying on Rick.

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: Deb, we're pretending to be hookers.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Right in here. The big show starts in one minute.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: I'm glad you guys came by... What's the occasion?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Rick's got an important announcement to make.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Yeah. What is it?

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Yeah, man. Let's throw a bachelor party with drugs, booze and broads.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Yeah. Right. All the things that make life worth living.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Where's the women, man? We gotta have women.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: Chulo, one thing at a time.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Sex is my one thing. I'm good at it.

turns.speaker: O'NEILL
turns.text: I don't get it, but at least Gary's got the real stuff coming up here in a few minutes.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Women!

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Hey, you guys, what's going on?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: We're going for a little liquid refreshment.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Great. I'll go with you. Wait a second. Hey, Raul! Move that car, will you?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I've decided not to run for President.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Too bad, man, that blows my chance to be Ambassador to France.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Man, you're losing your audience.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Okay... This is it... I'm getting married.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yes, gentlemen. Saturday after next, I lose my amateur standing and turn pro.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Hey, man, congratulations!

turns.speaker: RYKO
turns.text: You sure Gary's got this whole party deal together?

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: Yeah, man, he's got us a great room at the hotel and lots of chicks.

turns.speaker: RYKO
turns.text: I hope so. Hundred bucks apiece is a lot of dinero.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: What time are we supposed to get to the hotel?

turns.speaker: RYKO
turns.text: All right!

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: When do the girls get to the party?

turns.speaker: RYKO
turns.text: Denmark makes great Nautilus equipment.

turns.speaker: CHULO
turns.text: I'd like to jerk and press those babies.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: And...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Bond... James Bond.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Cole. Don't you know it's bad luck to see the groom before the wedding?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I want Debbie.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Cole...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You dump her and I'll give you cash.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What's Debbie's blue book value right now?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Five thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Seventy-five hundred.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Not interested.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Okay, ten thousand plus a G.E. toaster oven, a Litton microwave, a Cuisinart...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'm marrying Debbie.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Michelin tires... brand new. A set of Sears Best metric tools...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What is this person's story here?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Thanks, Dad.  Cole, go away.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: He's gonna hurt you, Debbie. He'll never be true to you the way I would.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Thank you. We'll all keep that in mind. 'Bye now.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Rick, I want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Ah, Cole.  I don't remember ordering an asshole from room service.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I don't want any trouble.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh, come on, just a little.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I'm ready to make you another deal.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Ooh, be still, my heart.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: See that down there? That's my most prized possession. My new Porsche.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Great car.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: The best.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I love that car.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'm very happy for you two.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I'll trade you my Porsche for Debbie. An even swap.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: The car for Debbie?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I mean it. The car is yours. Dump Debbie.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Gee, guys, what should I do? The car or Debbie?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Low mileage... Handles like a dream.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: So does Debbie.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Shit, shit, shit, shit. My car's gone!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Maybe it had something to do.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Rick... Debbie is mine. She'll always be.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Cole, when was the last time you had a lobotomy?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You've had it. I'm gonna get you.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Cole, what the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: She's mine!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: He and Debbie stand outside the theater, which is a multi-plex cinema. Fourteen movie theaters under one roof. Prominent is a sign which reads: "24 HOUR 3D FESTIVAL!" Cole drags Debbie into one of the theaters. The gang runs up to the theaters.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Fan out and look for them.

turns.speaker: MR. T
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Mr. Thomerson.

turns.speaker: MR. T
turns.text: Yes, son, did you find out where the bachelor party is?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Yes I did.

turns.speaker: MR. T
turns.text: Fine. How's everything going?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Not so good. He wouldn't listen to reason. He stole my car... my Porsche... I can't find it anywhere...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Hi, everybody. Am I late?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Not at all. We're just finishing lunch.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: So, Cole, you been practicing your game?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Sure have...

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Nice shot.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: I know you're as unhappy as I am about Debbie's marriage to Rick.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Yes, sir, I am.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Cole, I don't want you to give up on her.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I've tried to change her mind.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: It's not her mind you need to change. It's Disneyland head in there.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: But how can I do that?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: If it were me, I'd reason with him first. Then, if that failed...  ...I'd take more persuasive action.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Thanks for the advise, sir.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Keep me informed.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: So, he's playing hard ball. Well, two can play that game.  Go after him. Stop at nothing. You hear me?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: What? I'm sorry, sir, I can't hear you.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Some fat slob in the next booth is making a lot of noise.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Well, tell the asshole to shut up.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Right.  Hey, shut up. Okay, sir.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Sorry, I can't hear you. Some pin head's yelling...  Shut up, I'm talking here.  Now look, I want you to go back and I don't care what you do. Stop that marriage.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Cole, my God, boy, what are you doing here? What happened?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: The bachelor party's upstairs. They made me get naked. They hung me from the window so high up it was so scary I fell down...

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Take hold of yourself. What room are they in?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: All right, I'll go up there and take care of this myself.  You look awful, son. Go find yourself some clothes.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Cole?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Over here, Deb... in the Smokehouse.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Cole, we've got to talk.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Finally realized Rick's a jerk, huh?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: No, Cole, I...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: It's all right, I forgive you. I'm not the vengeful type. We'll forget what happened. Why don't we take a trip together? Maybe kill a few lions in Kenya over Christmas.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Cole, listen to me... I've got to tell you...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You know, when you dumped me for that wimp, I thought, Cole, she'll be back. God wants the two of you to be together, and sure enough...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Cole, I'm marrying Rick.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You're marrying him? Then why are you coming back to me?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I'm not. I just thought I should tell you myself before you heard it somewhere else.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You know how that makes me feel, Deb? Wanta know how that makes me feel?  Angry, Deb.  Yesss, that's the word, angry. But if he makes you happy, you go right ahead. I want you to be happy, Deb.  No matter what, no matter how angry it makes me, no matter how much it hurts. Be happy, Deb. Be oh, so very, very happy.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Cole, I'm sorry, I...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: That's all right, Deb. Go be happy and smile a lot, Deb. Do it for me.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I'm going now, Cole.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I understand, Deb. 'Bye... be happy.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: God, you're a slob.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: But a fabulous cook.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: What are we having?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: It's either meatloaf, Swiss steak or charred flesh. I won't know till it's finished.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I think your dinner's burning.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Don't worry... it's supposed to do this.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Want to hear something great? Bobbie and Phoebe are throwing me a shower. It's really gonna be fun.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Not as much fun as the bachelor party the guys are throwing for me.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: You're going to have a bachelor party?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Of course. I'm a traditional guy... It's a traditional event.  Well, what do you think?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: It looks awful.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yes, but looks are deceiving...  Not in this case, however.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Are you going to have women at your party?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: No, sweetheart, it's a stag party. Does stay home.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I'm not talking about does. I'm talking about hookers.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh, those. Why do you ask?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Because from what I've heard, it's a tradition and you're a traditional guy.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Huh? Wha...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I can't sleep.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh... I got something for that.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Stop fooling around... I need to talk.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I don't know... I just feel scared.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: The wedding, my parents, your family, our friends, my job, the future, our relationship, the caterers, my gown, your tuxedo, our honeymoon, the apartment, my shower, your bachelor party...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I think the only think you've left out are our relations with the Soviet Union. Sweetheart, everything's gonna be all right.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Before or After I have my nervous breakfown?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: C'mere.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: That feels so great.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Good...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Um... that's very relaxing.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Now, I want you to lie down and drift off to slumberland.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well... twenty-four more hours to go and tonight we'll share with our friends and loved ones the joys of those last moments of singleness.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: You better not have too much joy.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Wouldn't think of it. Because tomorrow...  We're going to the chapel and we're...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Gonna get married...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: This is it, lady. Last stop.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Can't I just go with you guys?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Sorry, we got men's business to do. It's no place for a lady.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Remember, you promised... no screwing around.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Did I promise that? I don't remember that...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: You're really pissing me off.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Okay, I promise... I swear on my mother's grave.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Your mother's not dead.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, if I go back on my word, I'll kill her.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Have a good time. Don't make it too late.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Anything you say, ma'am. Have a fun shower. Use soap.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Don't turn on the lights, sugar.  I'll lead you around.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: How wonderful. A seeing eye hooker.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Why don't you get undressed.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I can't trust you!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: C'mon, I knew it was you.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Rick, you're lying!

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Let go of me!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Debbie, I'm telling you, I didn't do anything, hardly.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: The marriage is off. Now you can screw around with your friends for the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I don't want that. I want to be with you.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: And I want to be with someone who understands the meaning of the word commitment.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I am committed. I love you.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You don't believe me? Okay, fine.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: See? And these are not just ordinary party-goers -- there are professionals in this crowd -- I didn't want any of them. You... You're what I want. Understand?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Great. Now, what do you want to do about it?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Let's get naked.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You're on.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: This has been quite a night. Here's a thought. Why don't we go home and give our private parts a workout?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: You're so romantic...

turns.speaker: ILENE
turns.text: If I were you, I'd worry less about the shower and more about Rick's bachelor party.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Ilene, why would I want to do that? I trust Rick.

turns.speaker: ILENE
turns.text: Of course you do. I trusted my ex, Mel, too. Cousin, I can only talk from experience. What do you think they do at these parties, have tea and play scrabble?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Ilene, Rick promised...

turns.speaker: ILENE
turns.text: Debbie, don't be naive. Men are pigs.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Are you sure this is a good idea?

turns.speaker: ILENE
turns.text: Look, you heard what those hookers said. They were supposed to go to a bachelor party.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: That doesn't mean it was Rick's party.

turns.speaker: ILENE
turns.text: Debbie, men are pigs -- if they can have women, we can have men.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: ILENE
turns.text: Look, girls -- I'll stay behind and hold them off. The rest of you break for it!

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Ilene, are you crazy?

turns.speaker: ILENE
turns.text: I know what I'm doing... Go!

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: I'm using the same caterer for the shower I had for our Christmas party last year.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Great, Mom.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Why is Cole here?

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: You know your father enjoys his company.

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: A strange wang right in my palm.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Ilene, we don't really know that.

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: What kind of job? I'm a housewife.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Quiet, Mother.

turns.speaker: MRS. THOMERSON
turns.text: I hope Ilene's all right.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I hope those guys are all right.

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE
turns.text: Ed, we're so glad you could come over at the last minute and judge our little beauty pageant.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: My pleasure, Al... Always happy to help out in a pinch...  Excuse me. I better call my service... tell them where I am.

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE
turns.text: Congratulations on your daughter's wedding. Who's she marrying?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: A real turd.

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE
turns.text: Well... hope she'll be very happy.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Great bathing suit.

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE
turns.text: I think I screwed that one once.

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE
turns.text: Thanks for helping us out, Ed. We appreciate it.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMERSON
turns.text: Any time, Al.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: So we want your best girls, the cream of your crop.

turns.speaker: JUMBO
turns.text: Let's see your bread.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Park View Hotel, Room 1002.

turns.speaker: JUMBO
turns.text: They'll be up there in a half hour.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Okay. Nice to meet you both.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Jumbo, where the hell are the women?

turns.speaker: JUMBO
turns.text: What are you talking about, asshole?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Your whores never showed up.

turns.speaker: JUMBO
turns.text: They left an hour ago, pink nuts.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Screw you!

turns.speaker: JUMBO
turns.text: That's it, prick lips.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: What are you...

turns.speaker: JUMBO
turns.text: I've had it, numb nuts... How much money you got?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JUMBO
turns.text: Because I'm pissed off. Now give me your cash.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: This is bad public relations. I was planning to do a lot of business with you. But now I'm going to have to go elsewhere.

turns.speaker: JUMBO
turns.text: Hey. I'm sorry. You want girls. I'll give you girls.

turns.speaker: JUMBO
turns.text: Give him the works.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: That's more like it.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Screw you... Screw that... Don't jerk me around. You promised me 1500 seats for the Police Concert... 1500, not fifteen!... Screw that... Screw you -- Screw Sting.  Hi, guys.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Gary, you're quite an animal.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Screw you...
